references.reason: This foundational paper introduced collective classification, a crucial technique in graph data processing that directly relates to the zero-shot node classification task addressed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This highly influential paper introduced graph convolutional networks (GCNs), a powerful class of neural networks used for graph data processing and directly relevant to the methods explored in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Zero-shot node classification with decomposed graph prototype network
references.reason: This paper directly addresses zero-shot node classification, proposing a novel method that directly informs the techniques and approaches used in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Spectral networks and deep locally connected networks on graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces spectral networks, an approach to neural networks on graphs that leverages spectral graph theory, a key component of the methods used in the target paper.

references.paper_title: On spectral clustering: Analysis and an algorithm
references.reason: This seminal paper on spectral clustering provides essential theoretical background and foundational algorithms that underpin the spectral techniques used in the target paper.
